We are looking for clinicians who would like to combine their love for people and strong work ethic with the opportunities to advance their career.
In return for your expertise, you'll enjoy excellent training, industry-leading benefits and unlimited opportunities to learn and grow. Be a part of the team leading the nation in healthcare.

Responsibilities
 Responsibilities:

Job Description:
Responsible for managing a continuum of care from admission through discharge for assigned patients either inpatient or outpatient.
Partners with medical staff, utilizes scientific evidence for best practices, relevant data and compliance with the mission/philosophy, standards, goals and core values.
Proactively assesses all potential case management and CCS member cases identified from either external or internal sources and actively manages all high risk, high volume cases throughout the continuum of the member's health care needs or until they reach a maintenance mode.
Demonstrates a multidisciplinary approach in identifying problems, communication and negotiating with the member's PCP, family members, caregivers, other members of the health care team, community resources and the Health Plans.
Researches and refers members to sources for alternative funding, community services and other services which may provide support to the patient and family.
Tracks all CCS referrals for timely notification of decisions. Assists Medical Director with CCS appeals as applicable.
Coordinates care for CCS members between PCP, CCS providers and other physicians and providers as needed as applicable.
Identifies cases for possible peer reviewers to evaluate the appropriateness and necessity of care and or quality of care concerns.
Qualifications:
Graduated from an accredited school of nursing
Active CA RN/LVN License
Two years utilization/case management experience in the managed care industry a plus
Word processing and computer experience required.

Job Description







Position Title: Licensed Vocational Nurse

Service Area:

Department:

Supervised by: Registered Nurse, Program Administrator, Program Director, Area/Regional Director

FLSA Status: Non-Exempt



POSITION SUMMARY:

The purpose of this position is to provide coordination of services for client medical needs on an individual basis. The purpose of the LVN is to assist in coordinating health care services on the basis of each client's individual needs and administering total nursing care for each client. Ensures a high standard of nursing care is met and maintained in compliance with Federal and State Regulations.



EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:

* High School Diploma or GED required.

* 6 months to one year experience and experience with individuals with developmental disabilities is preferred.



QUALIFICATIONS:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Effective communication and interpersonal skills are needed. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Must be eighteen years of age or older. Some programs/job positions require 21 years of age.

* Must have and maintain certificate as LVN as required by the state regulations.

* Must be proficient in medical knowledge.

* Working knowledge of computers including experience with MS Word and MS Excel.

* Completed the DSP certification training obtaining a DSP 1 & DSP 2

* Must have the ability to satisfy a background check, health screen and comply with the company's drug free workplace policy.

* Must have the ability to meet physical requirements.

* Must possess a good driving record, provide proof of current driver's license and insurance if program/job position requires. Authorized drivers must be 21 years of age or older and Van drivers must be 25 years of age or older.

* Must secure and maintain First Aid and CPR certification within 30 days.

* Demonstrated competency with skills and abilities to work successfully with the challenging behaviors of supported individuals in care.

* Demonstrated competency in basic knowledge of daily living skills, communication, community interaction and recreation.

* Demonstrated capacity to be an appropriate role model, including exhibiting mature behavior and making appropriate decisions.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Include the following & other duties may be assigned

Operational

* Familiar with the needs and the overall health status of clients.

* Document all issues related to care and services delivered to the clients.

* Updates med sheet and physical orders on computer.

* Reports client's status to the home administrators and the Clinical Coordinator.

* Reviews medical book routinely to ensure appointments are scheduled as directed including but not limited to labs and x-rays.

* Ensures client's weights are being done as ordered by physician.

* Takes blood pressures, pulse rate and respirations on clients as directed or in times of need.

* Assists with emergency situations to include assisting clients to the emergency room, quick care services or to the physician.

* Maintains a high standard of nursing care and maintained in compliance with state and federal regulations.

* Meets weekly with the Clinical Coordinator to review client's status.

* Follows infection control procedures.

* Performs routine housekeeping functions.

* Provides general and preventative nursing care as needed, and in accordance with need, ensuring that all assessments, appointments and evaluations are updated. Appointments include: annual History and Physical, vision, dental, neurology, psychiatric, audiology, podiatry and other appointments as needed.

* Ensures that any client that has a medical procedure done on an out-patient basis that requires sedation such as g-tube replacement, dental work, colonoscopies, etc., are put on the 48 hour assessment protocol. During the 48 hour period post procedure, the client is to be assessed after returning to the home, on day 1 post procedure and on day 2 post procedure.

* Implement any med changes.

* Ensures that all ICF MR Clients are assessed (head-to-toe) upon admission, quarterly and as needed.

* If caseload includes g-tube clients, ensures specialized monthly g-tube client assessment is completed. G-Tube Monthly assessment to include: Temperature,

* Oxygen saturation, blood pressure, pulse, respirations, auscultation of lung sounds and bowel tones, assessment of stoma site and surrounding tissue and skin color.

* Ensures annual nursing summaries are done in a timely fashion

* Rounds to home a minimum of 4 days per week (Monday through Friday) -- LPN may round at any hour. LPN may opt to round via phone one day of the week to allow one uninterrupted day to work on paperwork in office. The LPN is required to contact each home in the morning via telephone and review recent health status forms (may also be faxed to LPN). Throughout the day, the LPN will maintain contact with home via phone/fax and will be required to do on-site visit if assessment of a client if necessary.

* Reviews Health Status Reports on a daily basis (weekdays) and provide appropriate instructions and follow up. On the day the LPN does not round, LPN may review Health Status reports via phone or fax.

* Reviews Incident and Accident Reports in a timely fashion and follow-up as necessary.

* Attends IPP meetings

* Assists in arranging transportation for clients to medical appointments.

* Is on-call for homes weekdays from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m.

* Nurse on duty on call weekdays from 3 p.m. to 7 a.m. and weekends and holidays 24 hours per day -- NOD rotation begins Thursday at 3 p.m. ends the following Thursday at 7 a.m. LPN rotation for NOD is 1 time per month and schedule/frequency may change as necessary.

* Ensures that clients receive annual flu vaccination and Tb test upon admission

* Flushes client's ears as needed.

* Participates on Interdisciplinary Team including Physicians, Administrators, Qmrps, RSCs, Direct Care Staff, etc.

* Notification of physician for change of condition, medication changes, dietary recommendations

* Client education regarding dietary and health issues

* Orders and maintains over-the-counter medication supply as well as medical supplies such as Band-Aids, syringes, gloves, etc.

* Assists in maintaining Medical Records on each resident which includes:

* Standard documentation on each client at a minimum of monthly and as needed for change in condition, physician orders, med changes, etc.

* Ensures emergency information face sheet is current in each client's book.

* Ensures physician recapitulation orders are current.

* Ensures each client's MAR contains current information.

* Tracks and maintains all client immunization records

* Routinely audits client charts to ensure compliance

* Sets up monthly medications for clients -- this includes completing a cycle fill for each client and faxing to Shared Pharmacy.

* Communicates with pharmacy for medication changes throughout the month as necessary.

* Generates current MAR at the beginning of each month and ensure accuracy.

* Conducts G-tube classes once per month.

* Conducts Infection control education.

* Ensures OSHA compliance.

* Addresses infection control issues as needed with regular staff in-services

* Complete Med Certification observations for all med passers.

* In-services quarterly and as needed on variety of topics that may need to be addressed

* Administers TB test, Hepatitis B vaccination (series), and Tetanus shots as necessary for employees.

* Assesses injured employees as necessary.

* Maintains accurate and current information pertaining to employee wellness library

LPN/RN Assistance

* Assists LPN with taking and recording vital signs including but not limited to weight, height, blood pressure, pulse.

* Assists LPN with charting vital signs in patient medical charts.

* Assist with resident medication passes, as needed.

* Assists LPN with treatment assessments, evaluations

* Assists LPN with upkeep of client files including, but not limited to filing Doctor's orders and filing evaluations from Physical Therapist, Occupational Therapist, Speech Therapist, Hearing, Vision, and Dental.

* Completes ten-minute meeting documentation. Prepares report for sending to parent/ guardians, assures review by Administrator, QMRP, Program Director.

* Transports patients to and from medical appointments.

* Maintains trainers certification as outlined in staff development procedures including attendance at in-service training and staff meetings, maintenance of quality and quantity of training, successful completion of required course works and training proficiency checks

* Trained and certified staff may assist in passing medication and must make consistent and accurate medication passes, follow Infection control procedures, assist LPN in setting and documenting needed medical appointments.

Positive Working Environment

* Respect and honor diversity (race, religion, marital status, age, sexual orientation, color, creed, national origin, and abilities.

* Maintain respectful relationships which recognize client's rights as a citizen and promotes their dignity, well-being, personal choice, and self-esteem.

* Treat all co-workers with respect and in a manner that will promote teamwork, productivity and positive working environment.

* Work collaboratively with others to accomplish goals and/or assigned tasks.

* Meet expected outcomes or let supervisor know of any needed direction, support or resources to ensure attainment of expected outcomes.

* Participate fully, positively and productive in team meetings to assist in achieving the desired outcomes of the meeting.

* Inform team members of import information that will assist in providing quality supports to the department.

* Follow dress code guidelines to provide an appropriate role model and to represent quality services.

* Act according to the guidelines of the company policies & procedures and the employee handbook. Maintain working knowledge of these documents by reviewing them at least once a year.

* Stay calm in challenging situations, maintains positive attitude, and serves as a role model for individuals served and employees.

* Conduct self in a way that leaves a positive impression with families, customers, and the community.

* Maintain regular and consistent attendance and punctuality; flexibility as needed for schedules.

Growth and Development

* Participate in training on a regular basis to stay current and up to date on protocols and company practices.

* Complete Basic Orientation and attend other in-service training as recommended.

* Set and achieve performance and development goals as scheduled through the Performance Review and Plan (PRP) process.

* Attends IHCA classes -- minimum of 2 during annual conference

* Maintains membership in DDNA -- access classes as desired for continuing education.



Safety and Health

* Maintain a safe working environment, follow safe work practices, and contribute to overall team safety as defined in the employment services manual to include protecting residents from physical, verbal, or mental abuse, being aware of residents' whereabouts at all time, notifying appropriate staff of safety hazards, being familiar with emergency evaluation procedures, being familiar with emergency first aid procedures and assisting as necessary

* Ensure each individuals living environment is safe and sanitary. Provide support services as needed to maintain clean, attractive homes.

* Ensure individuals are free from abuse, mistreatment and/or neglect and complete all necessary mandated reports.

* Respond effectively to emergencies and illnesses. Follow procedures and notify supervisor as required.

* Monitor health needs, including medications, special diets, and notify supervisor of any outstanding needs.

* Provide assistance to individuals to ensure they receive medications as prescribed, as required. Make consistent and accurate medication passes, following all policy and procedures for medication passes.

* Provide individuals with adequate supervision that is appropriate to their needs during work hours.

* Provide Lift and Transfer assistance (may include non-ambulatory individuals) requiring ability to bear and maneuver up to 50 or more pounds of unbalanced weight.

* Notify supervisor of any needed repairs or other concerns



SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:

This position has no supervisory responsibilities.



PHYSICAL, SENSORY & ENVIRONMENTAL:

The demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Quiet to moderate noise level in work environment and often required to sit for long periods of time

* Required to talk, hear and the ability for close vision.

* Often required to use hands and fingers to handle, feel or to manipulate keys on a keyboard.

* Occasionally required to stand, walk, reach with arms and hands, climb/balance, stoop, kneel or crouch.

* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, and ability to adjust focus.

* The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.

Position Summary:
 The Clinical Practice Coordinator (CPC) is an integral part of the Dignity Health Medical Foundation (DHMF) care team. The CPC performs the functions of assessing, planning, implementing and evaluating plans of care for attributed patients. Working in the context of a primary care medical home, the CPC utilizes a team approach in continuous partnership with families and physicians to promote: timely access to needed care, continuity of care, and the enhancement of patient and family well-being by coordinating appropriate resources to facilitate and ensure the patient's progress through the continuum of care. Actively participates in the quality review process and assures continual improvement of patient safety, clinical practice and quality patient care. The CPC job functions include, but are not limited to: clinical practice, leadership, consultation, education, research and professional development. Clinical Practice Coordinators promote collaboration with physicians and other providers, clinic leadership and staff; demonstrating knowledge and skills necessary to provide care coordination and implement population health initiatives to improve quality outcomes for patients and decrease cost of care. The CPC provides clinical oversight and leadership to RNs, LVNs and MAs providing care to patients. Additionally, the CPC demonstrates knowledge of principles of growth and development over the life span; possesses the ability to assess data reflective of the patient's medical status and functional abilities; and interprets appropriate information needed to identify patient requirements relative to the patient's age-specific needs. The CPC provides direction to clinical staff to implement DHMF policies and procedures and is responsible for coordinating a wide range of patient self-management support and disease registry activities. Success will be measured by the results of the process and outcome performance measures of the patient population.
